name: Wizard
description: Wizards are supreme magic-users, defined and united as a class by the spells they cast. Drawing on the subtle weave of magic that permeates the cosmos, wizards cast spells of explosive fire, arcing lightning, subtle deception, and brute-force mind control.

traits.name: Starting Proficiencies
traits.description: As a Wizard, you are proficient with daggers, darts, slings, quarterstaffs, and light crossbows. Your saving throw proficiencies are Intelligence and Wisdom. You are also proficient in two skills of your choice.

features.name: Spellcasting
features.description: As a student of arcane magic, you have a spellbook containing spells that show the first glimmerings of your true power. You know three cantrips of your choice from the wizard spell list. You have a spellbook containing six 1st-level wizard spells of your choice. You prepare your list of spells from your spellbook.

features.name: Arcane Recovery
features.description: You have learned to regain some of your magical energy by studying your spellbook. Once per day when you finish a short rest, you can choose expended spell slots to recover. The spell slots can have a combined level that is equal to or less than half your wizard level (rounded up), and none of the slots can be 6th level or higher.

effects.name: Arcane Recovery
effects.description: Recover spell slots with a combined level of half your wizard level (rounded up).

features.name: Arcane Tradition
features.description: You choose an arcane tradition, shaping your practice of magic through one of eight schools: Abjuration, Conjuration, Divination, Enchantment, Evocation, Illusion, Necromancy, or Transmutation.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1.

features.name: Spell Mastery
features.description: You have achieved such mastery over certain spells that you can cast them at will. Choose a 1st-level wizard spell and a 2nd-level wizard spell that are in your spellbook. You can cast those spells at their lowest level without expending a spell slot when you have them prepared.

features.name: Ability Score Improvement
features.description: You can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or two ability scores by 1.

features.name: Signature Spells
features.description: You gain mastery over two powerful spells and can cast them with little effort. Choose two 3rd-level wizard spells in your spellbook as your signature spells. You always have these spells prepared, they don't count against the number of spells you can prepare, and you can cast each of them once at 3rd level without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to do so after a long rest.

subclasses.name: Bladesinging
subclasses.description: Bladesingers master a tradition of wizardry that incorporates swordplay and dance. Originally created by elves, this tradition has been adopted by non-elf practitioners, who honor and expand on the elven ways.

features.name: Training in War and Song
features.description: You gain proficiency with light armor, and you gain proficiency with one type of one-handed melee weapon of your choice. You also gain proficiency in the Performance skill.

features.name: Bladesong
features.description: As a bonus action, you can start the Bladesong, which lasts for 1 minute. It gives you a bonus to AC, walking speed, and concentration saving throws. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus.

effects.condition: on Constitution saves to maintain concentration while Bladesong is active

features.name: Extra Attack
features.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn. You can cast one of your cantrips in place of one of those attacks.

features.name: Song of Defense
features.description: When you take damage, you can use your reaction to expend one spell slot and reduce the damage by an amount equal to five times the spell slotâ€™s level.

features.name: Song of Victory
features.description: You can add your Intelligence modifier to the damage of your melee weapon attacks while your Bladesong is active.

effects.condition: with melee weapon attacks while Bladesong is active

subclasses.name: Order of Scribes
subclasses.description: Among wizards, the Order of Scribes is the most bookish. They magically awaken their spellbooks, turning them into trusted companions.

features.name: Wizardly Quill
features.description: As a bonus action, you can magically create a quill that doesnâ€™t require ink and can erase writing.

features.name: Awakened Spellbook
features.description: Your spellbook gains sentience. You can use it as a spellcasting focus, and temporarily change the damage type of spells you cast.

features.name: Manifest Mind
features.description: You can conjure forth the mind of your Awakened Spellbook as a spectral object, and cast spells as if you were in its space.

features.name: Master Scrivener
features.description: You can create a special magic scroll from a spell in your spellbook whenever you finish a long rest.

features.name: One with the Word
features.description: Your soul is entwined with your spellbook. You have advantage on Arcana checks, and can use the book's magic to prevent damage to yourself.

subclasses.name: School of Abjuration
subclasses.description: The School of Abjuration emphasizes magic that blocks, banishes, or protects.

features.name: Abjuration Savant
features.description: The gold and time you must spend to copy an abjuration spell into your spellbook is halved.

features.name: Arcane Ward
features.description: When you cast an abjuration spell of 1st level or higher, you can create a magical ward on yourself that has hit points equal to twice your wizard level + your Intelligence modifier. Whenever you take damage, the ward takes the damage instead. If this damage reduces the ward to 0 hit points, you take any remaining damage. The ward regains hit points equal to twice the level of the abjuration spell you cast.

features.name: Projected Ward
features.description: When a creature you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to cause your Arcane Ward to absorb that damage instead.

features.name: Improved Abjuration
features.description: When you cast an abjuration spell that requires you to make an ability check as part of casting that spell (as in Counterspell and Dispel Magic), you add your proficiency bonus to that ability check.

features.name: Spell Resistance
features.description: You have advantage on saving throws against spells. You have resistance to the damage of spells.

subclasses.name: School of Conjuration
subclasses.description: You favor spells that produce objects and creatures out of thin air.

features.name: Conjuration Savant
features.description: The gold and time you must spend to copy a conjuration spell into your spellbook is halved.

features.name: Minor Conjuration
features.description: You can use your action to conjure up an inanimate object in your hand or on the ground in an unoccupied space that you can see within 10 feet of you. The object can be no larger than 3 feet on a side and weigh no more than 10 pounds, and its form must be that of a nonmagical object that you have seen. The object is visibly magical, radiating dim light out to 5 feet.

features.name: Benign Transposition
features.description: You can use your action to teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space that you can see. Alternatively, you can choose a space within range that is occupied by a Small or Medium creature. If that creature is willing, you both teleport, swapping places.

features.name: Focused Conjuration
features.description: While you are concentrating on a conjuration spell, your concentration canâ€™t be broken as a result of taking damage.

features.name: Durable Summons
features.description: Any creature that you summon or create with a conjuration spell has 30 temporary hit points.

subclasses.name: School of Divination
subclasses.description: The School of Divination focuses on understanding the past, present, and future.

features.name: Divination Savant
features.description: The gold and time you must spend to copy a divination spell into your spellbook is halved.

features.name: Portent
features.description: After a long rest, roll two d20s and record the numbers rolled. You can replace any attack roll, saving throw, or ability check made by you or a creature that you can see with one of these foretelling rolls.

features.name: Expert Divination
features.description: When you cast a divination spell of 2nd level or higher, you regain one expended spell slot of a lower level.

features.name: The Third Eye
features.description: You can use your action to gain one of the following benefits for 1 hour: darkvision, ethereal sight, greater comprehension, or see invisibility.

features.name: Greater Portent
features.description: You roll three d20s for your Portent feature, rather than two.

subclasses.name: School of Enchantment
subclasses.description: The School of Enchantment focuses on magic that beguiles and mesmerizes others.

features.name: Enchantment Savant
features.description: The gold and time you must spend to copy an enchantment spell into your spellbook is halved.

features.name: Hypnotic Gaze
features.description: As an action, choose one humanoid you can see. If it fails a Wisdom save, it is charmed and incapacitated, with its speed reduced to 0.

features.name: Instinctive Charm
features.description: As a reaction when a creature you can see within 30 feet of you attacks you, you can divert the attack to another creature within range.

features.name: Split Enchantment
features.description: When you cast an enchantment spell of 1st level or higher that targets only one creature, you can have it target a second creature.

features.name: Alter Memories
features.description: When you cast an enchantment spell to charm one or more creatures, you can alter one creatureâ€™s understanding of its past, making it unaware of being charmed and forgetting a period of time.

subclasses.name: School of Evocation
subclasses.description: The School of Evocation focuses on magic that creates powerful elemental effects.

features.name: Evocation Savant
features.description: The gold and time you must spend to copy an evocation spell into your spellbook is halved.

features.name: Sculpt Spells
features.description: When you cast an evocation spell that affects other creatures that you can see, you can choose a number of them equal to 1 + the spellâ€™s level. The chosen creatures automatically succeed on their saving throws against the spell, and they take no damage if they would normally take half damage on a successful save.

features.name: Potent Cantrip
features.description: Your damaging cantrips affect even creatures that avoid the brunt of the effect. When a creature succeeds on a saving throw against your cantrip, the creature takes half the cantripâ€™s damage (if any) but suffers no additional effect from the cantrip.

features.name: Empowered Evocation
features.description: You can add your Intelligence modifier to one damage roll of any wizard evocation spell you cast.

effects.condition: to one damage roll of an evocation spell

features.name: Overchannel
features.description: When you cast a wizard spell of 1st through 5th level that deals damage, you can deal maximum damage with that spell. The first time you do so, you suffer no adverse effect. If you use this feature again before a long rest, you take necrotic damage.

subclasses.name: School of Illusion
subclasses.description: The School of Illusion focuses on magic that dazzles the senses and befuddles the mind.

features.name: Illusion Savant
features.description: The gold and time you must spend to copy an illusion spell into your spellbook is halved.

features.name: Improved Minor Illusion
features.description: You learn the minor illusion cantrip. If you already know it, you learn a different wizard cantrip. You can create both a sound and an image with a single casting.

features.name: Malleable Illusions
features.description: As an action, you can change the nature of an existing illusion spell that you are concentrating on.

features.name: Illusory Self
features.description: As a reaction, you can create an illusory duplicate of yourself to cause an attack to miss you. Usable once per short or long rest.

features.name: Illusory Reality
features.description: When you cast an illusion spell of 1st level or higher, you can choose one inanimate, nonmagical object that is part of the illusion and make that object real for 1 minute.

subclasses.name: School of Necromancy
subclasses.description: The School of Necromancy explores the cosmic forces of life, death, and undeath.

features.name: Necromancy Savant
features.description: The gold and time you must spend to copy a necromancy spell into your spellbook is halved.

features.name: Grim Harvest
features.description: Once per turn when you kill one or more creatures with a spell of 1st level or higher, you regain hit points equal to twice the spellâ€™s level, or three times if it is a necromancy spell.

features.name: Undead Thralls
features.description: When you cast animate dead, you can target one additional corpse or pile of bones, and undead you create have additional hit points and add your proficiency bonus to their weapon damage.

features.name: Inured to Undeath
features.description: You have resistance to necrotic damage, and your hit point maximum can't be reduced.

features.name: Command Undead
features.description: As an action, you can target one undead creature you can see and force it to make a Charisma save. If it fails, it becomes friendly to you and obeys your commands.

subclasses.name: School of Transmutation
subclasses.description: The School of Transmutation focuses on magic that changes energy and matter.

features.name: Transmutation Savant
features.description: The gold and time you must spend to copy a transmutation spell into your spellbook is halved.

features.name: Minor Alchemy
features.description: You can temporarily alter the physical properties of one nonmagical object, changing it from one substance into another (wood, stone, iron, copper, or silver).

features.name: Transmuter's Stone
features.description: You can create a transmuterâ€™s stone that stores magical energy. You can grant its holder one of several benefits, such as darkvision, increased speed, or resistance to a damage type.

features.name: Shapechanger
features.description: You can cast the polymorph spell on yourself to transform into a beast of CR 1 or lower without expending a spell slot.

features.name: Master Transmuter
features.description: You can use your action to consume your transmuterâ€™s stone to use one of four powerful effects: Major Transformation, Panacea, Restore Life, or Restore Youth.
